lenArticle: Twenty CBME undergraduates spent two weeks this summer at a coal liquefaction plant in Inner Mongolia, owned by the Hong Kong Towngas group. Through this internship, the students gained an in-depth understanding of the whole production process and all major facilities involved. They visited production units such as air separation, water purification/wastewater treatment, coal gasification, methanol synthesis and hydrocarbon production.

VISITING PROFESSOR IS ENVIRONMENT, SUSTAINABILITY AND ENERGY DIVISION AWARD 2013 WINNER Dr Rafael Luque, Visiting Professor and Distinguished Engineering Fellow of CBME, was recognized with this award for his outstanding work in the multidisciplinary areas of nanomaterials, green chemistry and energy. Dr Luque (University of Cordoba, Spain) has significant experience on biomass and waste valorisation practises to materials, fuels and chemicals over the past 10 years. He has also published more than 160 research articles, filed 3 patent applications and edited 7 books, is a member of the Editorial Advisory Board of several reputed journals, and has been awarded numerous awards and recognition to his scientific career.

CBME third-year students Jeromy Chun Yuen CHAN, Ho San MAK, Lawrence Kai Qi YAN and Karen Pik Shuen HUNG won the Gold Award of the

organized by the Hong Kong Institution of Engineers. The team beat out 13 teams and 40 participants to win this prestigious award with an innovative system to recycle food. The system, based on a patent from Productivity Council, converts food waste into fertilizer, which is used for roof-top farming and organic gardens. Food grown will then be sold to students and funds raised will maintain the sustainability of the project. As food waste accounts for 40% of municipal waste and treatment of food waste can be difficult, the team took this opportunity to make a positive difference to HKUST's sustainability initiatives.
